title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live on Tuesday 9 May 2017 - BBC News
summary: school girl dies after falling from theme park ride .
why man spent six days with wife 's body .
teenager jailed over car ambush knife killing .
sharp rise in self-harm hospital admissions .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 wednesday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from the east midlands live page - updates will start again on wednesday at 08:00 .

documents.title: drayton manor death : live coverage continues
text: live coverage following the death of an 11-year-old girl at drayton manor park will continue this evening .
the youngster , believed to be from the leicester area , was on a school trip to the staffordshire theme park .

documents.title: breakinggirl who fell from drayton manor park ride has died
text: the 11-year-old girl who fell from a ride at drayton manor park has died , staffordshire police have confirmed .
the girl , believed to be from leicester , was on a school trip , police have said .

documents.title: shop assistant to spend days in a glass box
text: this 31-year-old woman from leicester is preparing to spend 50 hours locked in glass box to raise awareness of autism .
elena turland from netherhall works at the local tesco store in hamilton - that 's where the box will be .
she 'll go inside at midday on thursday and will not leave until 14:00 on saturday .
i 'll definitely do it .
i 'm going in with my eyes wide open and i 'll take it as it comes .
i 'll do plenty of reading in the box and i 've also lined up some entertainment to keep me occupied . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: men wanted following early morning 'disturbance '
text: do you recognise any of these men ?
police want to talk to them about a `` disturbance '' in derby last month .
it happened on sadler gate at around 04:00 on 1 april near the entrance to an alley leading to the blue note club .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'massive ' tarantula dumped on city street
text: 'massive ' tarantula dumped on city street

documents.title: police find handgun in nottingham house
text: a man from nottingham has appeared in court after being charged with possession of a firearm and ammunition .
the 25-year-old from nottingham road in the city was arrested after police found a handgun at a house in basford on friday .
he was remanded into custody and is due at nottingham crown court on 5 june 2017 .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : sunny and warm wednesday
text: cloud will steadily clear overnight leaving clear spells .
there 's the chance of a touch of frost in sheltered rural spots .
lows of 4c ( 39f ) in towns and cities .
the weather 's looking fine and dry wednesday with plenty of sunshine and some scattered cloud .
highs of 17c ( 63f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: 'inseparable ' sheepdog and lamb go on run
text: 'inseparable ' sheepdog and lamb go on run

documents.title: breakingyoung girl falls from water ride
text: a ride at drayton manor theme park has been closed following a major incident involving a child believed to be from the leicester area .
staffordshire police were called just before 14:30 to reports that a young girl had fallen from a water ride at the park .
the girl , thought to be 11 years old , has been airlifted to birmingham children 's hospital .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man who found hand-sized tarantula 'afraid of spiders '
text: michael fields has been showing the bbc where he discovered the abandoned tarantula on narborough road in leicester
i want to call him `` spider man '' now - but he 's actually very scared of them .
he said finding the creature was his `` worst fear '' .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: warburton wants smaller forest squad
text: warburton wants smaller forest squad

documents.title: cathedral asked to 'urgently ' relocate richard iii performance
text: plans for leicester cathedral to host performances of shakespeare 's richard iii this summer have been criticised by the group who led the project to find the remains of the former king .
the looking for richard project has said it was with `` great shock and deep disappointment '' they found out about the performance where king richard now lies at rest .
the group has said their hope in finding the remains was to be able to give the king the `` respect and human dignity so cons denied in 1485 '' when he was killed on the field of battle .
they 've accused leicester cathedral of using their connections with the last plantagenet monarch as a `` commercial and promotional venture '' .
the dean of leicester , revd david monteith , explains their decision to host the performance
along with the richard iii society , looking for richard project are urgently calling for the performances to be relocated to an alternative venue .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: council pays the price of fly tipping increase
text: there 's been a big increase in the number of fly tipping cases in mansfield .
the district council recorded a rise of 18 % over the past year , which it said cost it an extra £ 12,000 to clear up .
the authority has used cctv cameras to try to catch offenders , though the number of prosecutions fell from 11 to nine .
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: leicestershire 's 'bionic woman ' reveals next challenge
text: good luck , claire
the next challenge - simplyhealth great south run .
i am attempting 10 miles in 24 hours- all day and night !
good luck
go for it @ twitterid if anyone can do it it 's you .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: notts county votes for academies to play in efl trophy - despite fan survey
text: notts county has voted for `` category one '' academies and b teams to play in the efl trophy next season and in the 2018-19 campaign - despite 94 % of magpies fans voting against their inclusion .
in fact , almost half of those surveyed wanted the competition scrapped completely .
notts county owner alan hardy has been defending the club 's stance on twitter
guys , as a club we are losing £ 1.5m a year ! !
therefore the £ 20,000 win bonus is absolutely vital for our player budget for next season !
now at least we have a business plan and controlled budgets and costs to drive strategic decision making - and transparency at last !
stop talking sense bob some notts fans do n't understand it i 'm waiting for the first bring back trew banner .
5 months ago we were dead .
it majorly baffles me !
we may not always agree !
but we need to have faith , he will do what 's best for business !
surely setting a playing budget based on hypothetical win bonuses is ill advised ?
huh ?
the cost of notts county 's soul is £ 20k as it turns out .
also , turn a profit like walsall or afc wimbledon you dingbat
a chairman totally out of touch with the fans of the football club he owns
not sure those figures add up .
did dianne abbott compile this tweet for you ?
why bother asking your fans at all then , if your decision was already made ?
you really did n't think that would bite you on the arse ?
feel sorry for the fans of your club who you have completely ignored !
if you are losing money you are living beyond your means .
that attitude kills clubs .
just 75 wins a season needed then .
only 633 saw the sunderland b game - your lowest attendance in the trophy in at least 10yrs .
what if attendances fall further next year ?
thanks for the response and i completely understand the bottom line but please do n't justify the decision as this is what the fans voted for
so we just sell our soul ?
what if the pl offer a financial incentive for b teams in the league as well , do we just accept that for the £ £ ?
if you 're counting on 'win bonuses ' in your yearly player budgets it 's no wonder you 're losing 1.5m a year
@ twitterid do n't think using possible cup income to support player budgets is sustainable or desirable
i 'm sure it costs you more for running costs ?
glad our club does n't gamble playing budgets on hopefully winning a trophy game for £ 20k .
author: BBC Nottingham Sport

documents.title: watch : scene of passchendaele battle
text: this is polygon wood in ypres in belgium - it 's where 600 soldiers from the leicestershire regiment lost their lives in 1917
author: Ben Jackson
BBC Radio Leicester presenter

documents.title: notts county owner tweets displeasure after being hit with parking fine
text: it looks like yesterday was n't a great day for notts county owner alan hardy
rushcliffe borough council replied to mr hardy on twitter , saying : `` tickets are available in half hour increments ( 50p per 30 mins ) for this reason .
`` however , if you think the fine was issued unfairly you can challenge it . ''
well done @ twitterid sorry i was in a meeting creating employment for your borough !
will set-up elsewhere who 'll grant me 6 mins ( 5 % over )
hi alan , tickets are available in half hour increments ( 50p per 30 mins ) for this reason .
could it be they are forest fans
just to clarify , this account is n't linked to us at rushcliffe or the area in question .
cheers .
were they not also providing employment for their area when they gave that warden a job ?
rules are rules , you 're not special .
so that 's a speeding fine and a parking ticket in recent weeks , none of which were your fault
while we 're having a moan , can you improve the pay meters please .
card bit never seems to work
how much is it to park if you have to pay with a sodding credit card ?
been away 4 years , but bloomin'ell
however , if you think the fine was issued unfairly you can challenge it at - cheers .
you 'll take employment elsewhere because you did n't get the correct ticket ?
wow .
same in k-in-ash .
18 inches into a bus bay for 60 secs whilst went & got sumthing from office where i mploy 5 & got a ticket # jobsworths
we have to fund the feckless somehow john !
and do n't bother appealing , i appealed mine , waste of time .
they have no clue , nor care
we parked in nursery car park 17:47 on saturday .
put 50p in machine for half hour , ticket said expires at 18:00
i am afraid that politicians seem to subscribe to the notion that revenue is generated by taxing those who earn it for those that spend it .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: general election : thoughts from cossington
text: interesting chat this morning with staff at rh commercial vehicles in cossington in the first of my series about what leicestershire folk think of the election and politics in general .
some staff here stopped talking about brexit at work when the discussions started getting too heated .
sarah and steve who work on maintaining the firm 's lorries told me they wo n't vote this time .
sarah said `` it 's too complicated '' and has `` more important things to do '' like bringing up her children .
steve said he 's already voted and told politicians at the last election what he wanted , so why do it again ?
`` they should just be getting on with it , '' he told me .
author: Tim Parker
BBC Radio Leicester political reporter

documents.title: watch : how to tackle a speed bump
text: speed bumps , road humps , sleeping policemen , speed cushions - they have all sorts of names .
some here in nottingham could soon disappear under new government plans to cut air pollution .
while they 're still here i 've been out with former driving instructor john burnett to find out the best way to tackle them
author: Dominic Johnson
BBC Radio Nottingham reporter

documents.title: more nottinghamshire general election candidates announced
text: in the nottingham east constituency , labour 's chris leslie holds a majority of 11,894 .
barry holliday , of the liberal democrats , will be one candidate vying for the seat .
another liberal democrat , tad jones , has confirmed he will stand for the nottingham north constituency .
one of his rivals will be labour 's alex norris , who recently replaced graham allen .
in nottingham south , liberal democrat tony sutton and ukip 's david hollas will compete for the seat .
labour 's lilian greenwood and tory jane hunt will also stand .
conservative robert jenrick ( below ) will look to hold on to his 18,474 majority against liberal democrat david watts and labour 's chantal lee .
in rushcliffe , labour 's david mellen is standing again against ken clarke .
he also stood in 2015 .
joining the pair will be liberal democrat jayne phoenix .
finally , in sherwood , becky thomas - for the liberal democrats - and labour 's mike pringle have been confirmed as candidates for the seat alongside tory mark spencer .
author: Peter Saull
BBC Radio Nottingham Political Reporter

documents.title: nottinghamshire general election line-up starting to take shape
text: more nottinghamshire candidates for the upcoming general election have been announced .
in ashfield , labour 's gloria de piero ( below ) has confirmed she will be defending her majority of 8,820 .
in bassetlaw , liberal democrat leon duveen will look to overturn labour 's majority .
meanwhile , in broxtowe , it has been confirmed that fellow liberal democrat tim hallam will compete for the seat against conservative anna soubry and labour 's greg marshall .

tory carolyn abbott will face labour 's vernon coaker and liberal democrat robert swift for the gedling seat , while conservative ben bradley and ukip 's sid pepper will compete with labour 's sir alan meale for the mansfield constituency .
author: Peter Saull
BBC Radio Nottingham Political Reporter

documents.title: watch : henshaw turns to para-canoe
text: mansfield paralympian charlotte henshaw is switching sports .
after winning medals for swimming events in london and rio the 30-year-old has announced she 's retiring and is taking up para-canoe instead
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: your comments : tarantula abandoned
text: on facebook you 've been commenting on the story about an abandoned tarantula found in leicester .
gemma cobley said : `` not a big spider fan .
spent most of my life running from them .
however this guy has a life and a heart which means it 's just as important as any other species . ''
emma emzicles nutt said : `` ooya bleeder the size of that .
i 've been on narborough road today , luckily i seen this when i 'm back at home . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: afternoon weather update
text: staying dull , dry and cloudy for most of the afternoon with light winds and highs of 12c ( 54f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: waste charges at derbyshire recycling centres removed
text: derbyshire county council has cancelled its waste recycling centre charges under `` emergency powers '' .
residents were required to pay £ 3 per standard rubble sack to take soil , bricks , rubble and ceramics - such as bathroom furniture - to the centres .
but the fees were withdrawn on saturday following the county council elections .
the issue was the new tory administration 's top priority .
author: Chris Doidge
BBC Radio Derby, political reporter

documents.title: missing lamb and dog are 'best friends '
text: a woman from perlethorpe in nottinghamshire fears her pet dog and lamb have been stolen
blake the border collie and bella the lamb are `` best of friends '' according to natalie haywood , but the pair went missing yesterday while she was on the school run .
natalie said she was only out for an hour but when she got back the gate was open and the animals were gone .
bella is an orphan and is still being bottle fed .
a cash reward is on offer for their safe return .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: teenager jailed for ambush stab killing
text: teenager jailed for ambush stab killing

documents.title: your questions on the general election
text: your questions on the general election

documents.title: derbyshire county council announces new cabinet
text: derbyshire county council has announced its new cabinet after the conservatives took control of the authority from labour in last week 's local elections .
the tories won 37 of 64 seats to claim a majority and wipe out labour 's 22-seat majority from 2013 .
the new line-up - to be confirmed at the authority 's annual general meeting on 24 may - is :
councillor linda chilton is to become the council 's chairman , with councillor george wharmby selected as her vice-chairman .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: appeal following new parks crash
text: did you witness a crash in the new parks area of leicester on sunday ?
if so police want to hear from you .
they were called to aikman avenue at about 18:30 after a car collided with a bollard .
a man inside the vehicle was taken to the qmc in nottingham - he remains in a critical but stable condition .
a 19-year-old man was arrested in connection with the crash but has since been released .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : deer rescued in melton
text: some great work by the leicestershire fire and rescue service - they 've released this little muntjac deer which was trapped in railings in melton mowbray
they were called out by the rspca after the deer was spotted by a member of the public .
there was a similar incident last week when a deer was trapped in railings in birstall - that one had to be put down after it was rescued
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: teenager jailed over car ambush knife killing in nottingham
text: a teenager has been jailed for the manslaughter of a man who was stabbed in a car ambush on a nottingham street .
aqib mazhar , 21 , of russell road , was stabbed in the chest on the street where he lived on 1 june .
he died later in hospital .
his car was blocked in by three vehicles , trapping him as he came under attack , police said .
hamza omar adam ( below ) , 18 , formerly of berridge road , nottingham , admitted the manslaughter of aqib and was sentenced to seven years in prison yesterday .

nottinghamshire police said forensic evidence linked adam to the crime , and that fingerprints and cctv show he was responsible with the others in the group for the `` co-ordinated and planned attack '' .
a judge said in december mr mazhar 's murderer was still at large , and the force added : `` enquiries still continue to identify other members of the group responsible . ''
four men have already been jailed over mr mazhar 's killing .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: rugby international 's world war one memorial
text: i 'm in ypres in belgium remembering the dark days of world war one .
this july is the 100th anniversary of the battle of passchendaele - it will be marked with a ceremony near here .
amongst the 350,000 soldiers killed in battle were 600 from leicestershire .
this is the memorial of .
francis nathaniel tarr - he was an english international rugby union player who also played for leicester tigers
after his rugby career he became a solicitor in leicester .
he then volunteered for overseas service during the war .
he was killed in july 1915 near ypres on the western front after being hit by a shell splinter while serving as a lieutenant in the 1/4th battalion , leicestershire regiment .
tarr was one of 27 former england internationals killed in the war .
author: Ben Jackson
BBC Radio Leicester presenter

documents.title: photographer captures peregrine in derbyshire
text: springwatch has shared this amazing photo of a peregrine coming in to land on belper mill in derbyshire .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: man spent six days with wife 's dead body
text: man spent six days with wife 's dead body

documents.title: returning sharapova 'unlikely to play nottingham '
text: maria sharapova is unlikely to play at the aegon open in nottingham next month , the times reports .
the former world number one , who has recently returned from a 15-month doping suspension , will however get a wildcard into a tournament a week later in birmingham .
author: The Times

documents.title: leicester mural to mark selby moves a step closer
text: council bosses have drawn up a shortlist of `` about half a dozen '' walls where a mark selby mural could go , according to city mayor sir peter soulsby .
sir peter announced plans to honour the leicester snooker star after he won his third world championship title last week .
whilst the decision on a more permanent mural takes place , selby will be honoured with a on one of the empty shop fronts under leicester city hall on charles street .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : mining museum coming to nottinghamshire
text: a `` pop-up '' mining museum is coming to kirkby in ashfield and mansfield later this year .
the displays will be set up by former miners and include virtual reality headsets showing the inside of mines .
it 's hoped this temporary museum could become permanent .
eric eaton is from the nottinghamshire ex and retired miners association
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: no elation over burton safety - mousinho
text: no elation over burton safety - mousinho

documents.title: travel : latest on the roads
text: derby
nottingham
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: tarantula abandoned on leicester street
text: a tarantula the size of a hand has been found abandoned in a plastic box on a leicester street .
it 's been identified as a brazilian salmon pink bird-eating tarantula - the third largest species of tarantula - and was found by a `` shaken '' member of the public on narborough road .
the arachnid has now been taken on by a specialist exotics keeper .
the animal charity rspca is recommending that anyone interested in keeping a tarantula as a pet does their research first .
the member of the public who contacted us was understandably shaken by the size of the spider .
despite the size , the spider was not aggressive at all .
we are concerned that someone abandoned a spider in the street like this .
it is likely that the spider was an unwanted pet which someone decided to dispose of for whatever reason . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: maintenance work at derby bus station to begin
text: maintenance work at derby bus station is to begin today , derby city council has announced .
the work , which is taking place until 6 june , may result in some bays being closed , the council added .
a council spokesman said more information about bay closures will be available in the station and from bus operators .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: your photos : animals of watermead park
text: great photo by milan kubavat - taken at watermead park in leicester on sunday .
it reminds me of a scene from watership down
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: historian discovers region 's 'lost ' cycle lanes
text: did you know there were seven `` forgotten '' cycle lanes in the east midlands ?
the routes are part of hundreds across the uk that were created between 1934 and 1940 by the ministry of transport , but many of them fell out of use after world war two .
now a historian and cycling enthusiast has used google maps to locate these cycle ways as part of a campaign to reinstate them .
here 's the cycle ways he found :
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: sharp rise in self-harm hospital admissions
text: the number of cases of teenage girls being admitted to hospital for self-harming in leicestershire has more than doubled in the past three years .
figures obtained by the bbc show there were 190 cases between april last year and march this year .
this is a sharp increase from the 87 cases during the same period in 2014-15 .
it 's not just girls that are self-harming - there are some cases of boys being admitted but it 's much fewer .
during the same three year period it 's risen from 16 to 25 cases .
these are only the cases where the person has been hospitalised - it does n't cover the figures of those who self-harm and never seek help .
hannah britt self-harmed when she was younger and told us people need better information about the issue
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : east midlands weather outlook
text: here 's how it 's looking today
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: join us for today 's live news coverage
text: good morning leicestershire , derbyshire and nottinghamshire - alex smith and i will be writing the updates on today 's live page .
here you can get all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the east midlands .
if you 'd like to get in touch with us you can send an email or use facebook or twitter .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live
